name: San Clemente Palace Hotel & Resort

reviews.text: I stayed here for a business meeting this week.
reviews.title: Cavernous hotel that is anti-service out of season

reviews.text: The hotel is actually an old women's asylum that resonates as the rooms are deep with just one, slender window, lovely marble bathrooms and quality furniture.
reviews.title: The only place to stay for spring in Venice!

reviews.text: My room was placed on the very far side of the hotel, with no view and no air-con - despite it being a very hot March and the rooms had no ventilation.
reviews.title: Pure Bliss

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I was informed that the aircon only comes on in May - I left my window open and was plagued by mosquitos!!! Not good enough.
reviews.title: San Clemente Palace - Depends on what you want

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The food was good, very expensive - €48 for two course lunch (club sandwich and tiramisu). Service was great, though late dinners and bar tabs were held reluctantly, as staff seemed to want to go home.
reviews.title: Peace, quiet and space

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the San Clemente following our wedding in Ravello on the Amalfi coast. We had spent the previous week with our family and friends which was wonderful but very busy and we wanted to spend some time relaxing. However, we're not 'beach' people and wanted somewhere we could explore and see the sights as well as lounge by the pool, for this, the San Clemente is perfect.
reviews.title: The perfect Honeymoon

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: You are no more than a 15 minute boat ride from the island of Venice which is a service offered free by the hotel. For us, riding across the lagoon watching the sunset after a busy day sightseeing was the icing on the cake and never got old. The grounds of the hotel are well worth a wander around as is an afternoon spent by the pool both offering a tranquil retreat from the bustling city.
reviews.title: 5-Star Comfort

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is grand and elegant with sweeping staircases and never ending corridors. Our deluxe room was wonderful and spacious with views over the lagoon towards Venice and like the rest of the hotel it was immaculate. The staff were beyond helpful and polite particularly the lovely staff at the spa which is another must visit. There is a wide range on offer at breakfast and the prosecco made it just a bit more special. Dinner at the 'Le Maschere' restaurant is out of this world, I highly recommend the dessert simply entitled 'chocolate'. You can also have drinks and bar food out on the pier which is an amazing place to sit and watch the sunset.
reviews.title: Old-elegance formal, glorious but 21 euros for a G&T!

reviews.text: This is an old fashioned 5 star hotel with impeccable service amongst luxurious surroundings but do expect to pay handsomely for it. Food and drink are very expensive as are spa treatments and extras. In my opinion its worth every penny for a truly memorable stay.
reviews.title: Beautiful Hotel on Private Island
Pleasant days off!
reviews.text: The hotel is a converted palace on a private island. The rooms are large, the corridors longer than a football pitch. The staff are quiet, respectful and 100% bilingual, with all staff speaking excellent English.
Just returned from a 5 day stay here.
reviews.title: Tranquil lovely location in bustling Venice

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Grounds very nice, though pool closed. There is a small 3 hole golf course I was told.
reviews.title: Away from the crowds!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Rooms spacious and well appointed. I had a standard room and had a dinner meeting with room service and it was very comfortable.
reviews.title: A unique place to stay

reviews.text: Food was also very positive.
reviews.title: Perfect for couples.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Drinking Campari on the dock over looking Venice a great experience.
reviews.title: Great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The people at the San Clemente Palace went out of their way to assit us on our recent stay.....we had to go to the local hospital (fractured ribs from a fall prior to arrival at the hotel) and the staff arranged private water taxi service to the hospital and back.....monitiored our progress while we were at the hospital for over seven hours......and gave us excelllent service during our entire stay....our room was upgraded at no extra cost....dinner in the restaurant was outstanding...delightful bar for evening cocktails....easy access to St Mark's by their own complementary water taxi.......what a fabulous place.....will not stay anywhere else again when in Venice........
reviews.title: Fantastic hotel in Venetian lagoon......easy access to St Mark's

reviews.text: I dream about staying here again next time I'm in Venice. This is a truly gorgeous, tranquil, 5 star hotel you ever want. A hotel with corridors that larger than most rooms you ever stayed in.
reviews.title: The most gorgeous hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Love it to bits.
reviews.title: Stunning in every aspect.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: San Clemente Palace is a stunning hotel on a private island in Venice. From St. Mark's Square the hotel's lovely wooden boat takes you to the property. The grounds are stunning, although it was cold when we went so the pool was closed and the gardens were not in bloom. The room was beautifully furnished and the bathroom was exquisite. The breakfast was 5 star. The staff was superb, especially the concierge. We were able to leave our luggage on the last day of our trip and return for it in the afternoon. The boat runs from early morning to late night so it is very easy to get back and forth to St. Marks. ***We made our reservation on Hotels.com and it was substantially less expensive than the hotel's own site**. I would highly recommend this hotel.
reviews.title: Private island in Venice

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed here for 4 nights, had a suite on the top level, incredibly high ceilings, felt a little remote at first but their ferry service to st marks etc was always available Ontime and pleasant. They had some fantastic wines in their cellar had a Chateau Margaux with our amazing meal.
reviews.title: Perfect romantic escape

description: San Clemente Palace Hotel & Resort! 5-star Luxury Hotel in the heart of VeniceA private Island, in the heart of the Lagoon, where you can savor the light summer breeze, or admire a colorful Venice. An exclusive 5-star Luxury Hotel, with a unique location in Venice; the ideal destination for week-ends and holidays for partners and families, to celebrate weddings and private occasions, or to organize Meetings and International Events. Welcome to the San Clemente Palace Hotel & Resort, peaceful oasis in the Lagoon, where history, relax and culture are merged together, in a unique ambience… exclusive to you.San Clemente Palace Hotel & Resort! Hotel 5 stelle Lusso nel cuore di VeneziaUn’Isola privata, nel cuore della Laguna, dove poter assaporare la brezza estiva o da cui ammirare i colori che tingono Venezia. Esclusivo Resort 5 stelle Lusso, location unica a Venezia, meta ideale per fine settimana e vacanze, in due o in famiglia, per festeggiare matrimoni e ogni occasione privata, per organizzare meeting ed eventi internazionali. Benvenuti al San Clemente Palace Hotel & Resort, oasi di pace e tranquillità dove storia, relax e natura si fondono in un unico ambiente… solo per Voi.
